programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. Many ancient sites, and even recent ones like Roswell, all seem to be associated with reports of something coming down from the sky. Tsoukalos' research demonstrates that many of these places share a common symbol or shape-concentric circles. What is the significance of these designs, and is it possible they contain a coded message left by alien visitors?.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.

programme.title: Red Dwarf

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A grotesque, salivating genetic mutant goes on the rampage aboard the ship, spreading terror and stealing the crew's emotions, leaving Lister without fear and Rimmer with no anger. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Frances Barber.

A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dover to the Isle of Wight. Geographer Nicholas Crane hangs off the cliffs near Beachy Head, East Sussex, to discover how the chalk coastline was formed and historian Neil Oliver investigates why the Victorian Channel Tunnel was started more than 120 years ago but never finished. Meanwhile, anthropologist Alice Roberts visits the Isle of Wight, where she meets the men who helped launch Britain's first satellite.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The murder in 1943 of businessman Sir Harry Oakes in the Bahamas, where the Duke of Windsor was governor at the time, and implicated in influencing the outcome of his murder trial.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Thanks to the use of cutting-edge technology, a unique collection of artefacts salvaged from the underwater resting site of the famous wreck suggest new stories of love, deception, fate and heroics. This first episode touches on Fifth Officer Harold Lowe. After Titanic sank, his lifeboat was one of the few to go back and pick up survivors. One of the people he saved, Renee Harris, gifted him a set of gold-plated nautical equipment as a symbol of her gratitude. Plus, a well-preserved alligator bag recovered from the wreck site containing fascinating clues about the life of its owner.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Unexplained events during wartime, including German submarines that discovered previously unknown sea creatures and a Japanese bomb that floated on the jet stream.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring a look at sightings of UFOs during the Second World War, a US plan to use bats against Japan's cities, and a German attempt to persuade British POWs to change sides.

programme.desc: The team travels from Dublin to Derry. Mark Horton investigates a lost year in the life of the world's first ocean liner, while Neil Oliver meets the Londonderry women who secretly witnessed the surrender of German U-Boats at the end of the Second World War.

programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Documentary explaining how a squadron of low-flying bombers freed resistance fighters from Amiens Jail during the Second World War.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: First hand accounts of America's opening air raid on the Japanese archipelago, led by Colonel Jimmy Doolittle.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A former dealer is selling his entire medal collection - will Dave and Steve find anything worth bidding for? And Steve digs deep into a WW1 army medic's family history.

Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part two of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. Featuring contributions from Ripper expert Donald Rumbelow and writer Hallie Rubenhold, author of The Five - the only book to tell the lives of the victims.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Stories of people who came close to losing their lives during the Second World War, beginning with tales about the Chindits, the army's elite jungle troops division who beat the Japanese in a daring mission.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.desc: The gun battle on the thoroughfares of London in 1911 known as the Siege of Sidney Street. Four hundred rounds of ammunition were fired over six hours in one of the earliest news incidents to be captured by motion camera.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes some of the wildlife spectacles of southern Africa, starting out in a little-explored rainforest discovered less than a decade ago by scientists who spotted it on satellite maps. There, thousands of butterflies dance for the right to mate, while on a tiny island off Mozambique, green turtles emerge from eggs and begin a hazardous journey to the water - with pied crows and hungry crabs eager to get them. Cameras also capture one of the largest gatherings of great white sharks on the planet as 30 of the predators circle around a dead whale.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The bravery of the 333rd Field Artillery Battalion, a depleted unit of African-American soldiers who risked everything to fight off the Nazis at Bastogne, Belgium.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two

programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.desc: Dan Casper has a humiliating run-in with three yobs and later tries to save face by telling Amber they threatened him with a knife. On a less harrowing note, he also enjoys a romantic encounter with new Drugs Referral Officer Rochelle Barratt. Meanwhile, Honey finally confronts Scott, who breaks down and admits to killing his previous wife Karen. Understandably shocked by his confession, she implores him to turn himself in - but when the police arrive at their house, neither husband nor wife is anywhere to be seen.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin is faced with the consequences of his affair with Sally after a party on the houseboat. Meanwhile, Nick's fears for Ariadne escalate, but he is temporarily distracted when he has to rescue a boy from a well.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A party of pilgrims is imprisoned within Shrewsbury Abbey on suspicion of murdering an old man whose body is discovered in a sack. Sleuthing monk Cadfael is soon on the scent of the killer, boiling the corpse down to its bones to ascertain the cause of death - and finding a tiny cross that could provide a vital clue. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Michael Culver, Julian Firth and Anthony Green.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer incurs the wrath of the local golf club by declaring their prize trophy is a fake - and almost gets Lady Jane expelled into the bargain. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane, Chris Jury and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lady Jane and Lovejoy grow closer while visiting a Gothic temple in Scotland. Eric falls head over heels in love and Tinker feels all at sea. Drama, with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: The return of an old enemy leads to a series of problems, beginning with the loss of Sharpe's hard-earned captaincy, and culminating in a race against time to rescue his lover Teresa and their baby from the beleaguered city of Badajoz before Wellesley's forces attack. Military adventure, starring Sean Bean and Pete Postlethwaite.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads inadvertently turn up at the wrong Spanish villa and go skinny-dipping in its swimming pool - much to the outrage of the property's occupants, who arrive home unexpectedly. Tim Healy, Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Bill Paterson star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Two relentless tabloid reporters pursue the lads, convinced they are a pack of heavy-duty villains wanted back home for an audacious payroll robbery. Comedy drama, starring Christopher Fairbank and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to cure a patchy lawn at a select language school hiding dark secrets. The disappearance of a Polish student alerts them to a tale of passion, rivalry and revenge, and when a handyman is found with his throat cut they race to find the killer. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary investigate the mysterious death of a blind professor caught up in a bitter battle to save his beloved allotment from an unscrupulous land developer. A heady blend of weedkiller, cannabis and high finance hangs in the air as the duo search for clues - and another body is turned up before they track down the villain. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Kristin, Breen and Gina witness a fatal skydiving accident while celebrating Mike's birthday with a picnic. To make matters worse, Kristin knows the victim - entrepreneur Andre Barrington, an ex-boyfriend. When the cords are found severed, it becomes clear that his demise was either suicide or murder.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch's distressing childhood memories are evoked while investigating the death of an orphan under the care of the same Jesuit priest who taught him.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The team members set out to prevent a gangster's firearms deal, an act which Alex believes will prevent her being shot in 2008. To obtain evidence, they have to bring the suspect's boyfriend on side, taking him to a gay club where he can see his lover is not the man he thinks he is. Ray is forced to use all his macho charm to seduce the villain in front of witnesses. Drama starring Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene questions an old adversary about a robbery, and when it is revealed the crook has had to give up his life of crime, the detective worries that he too might be past his best. However, an interview with a murder suspect puts Alex in mortal danger - and leaves Gene drawing on his experience in an attempt to save her. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister defends a British ambassador's daughter accused of murdering an Austrian journalist, and learns a harsh lesson in the realities of political and diplomatic power. Foxcott is singed by an old flame, while Matt risks his father's anger by moving into a squat. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Lena Headey, Michael Feast and Oliver Ford Davies.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part one of two. A massive police search leads to the body of a missing five-year-old, the victim of sexual assault and strangulation. All the evidence points to a local drunkard being the guilty party _ but as the case goes to trial it becomes clear that the outcome is by no means assured. Gripping crime drama by Lynda La Plante, starring David Hayman, Kate Buffery, Helen McCrory and Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani realises Terry has been stabbed and rushes home in a bid to save him. Lance and Laura trace a suspect to a local pool hall, where they are taken aback to see Adam apparently buying drugs, while Samantha is impressed by Phil's uncharacteristic chivalry while working on a case, and asks if he'd like to get together with her socially. Unfortunately, their date is dramatically ruined by the reappearance of a figure from the past.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Okaro tries his best to keep it together at the funeral of his wife, son and daughter.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Drug dealer Adi Mateen is forced to reveal his true identity in a desperate bid to save Lance from gun-brandishing local youth Jordan Tomlin, and Samantha confronts Phil about Kate Maltby's pregnancy. Gina convinces herself that Adam is still hiding something, while Sheelagh works on a harassment case with Gabriel - only to discover the victim is his girlfriend.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam authorises DC Zain Nadir to meet Joshua Armstrong, a dealer at the top of the drugs chain - but the intervention of an armed motorcycle passenger threatens to cut short the entire investigation. Yvonne searches a storage unit hired by Honey's new husband Scott and finds a bloody glove, fuelling her suspicions that he killed his previous wife. Away from the line of duty, Phil angrily berates brother Steve for telling Kate Maltby about his daughter Madison.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Wingless Bird
programme.desc: Feature-length melodrama set in 1913, about the romantic relationship between Agnes Conway, whose parents own a sweetshop, and Charles Farrier, son of an altogether grander family. Agnes faces an added dilemma when she finds her heart divided between Charles and his soldier brother Reginald. Starring Claire Skinner and Edward Atterton.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new step-father, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: David is sent to a workhouse by his evil stepfather following his mother's death. But he finds an unlikely ally in the eternally optimistic gambler Mr Micawber. Ciaran McMenamin, Bob Hoskins, Trevor Eve and Maggie Smith star in the second part of the Dickens tale.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Now an ambitious young man making a name for himself in London, David returns to Suffolk with his schoolfriend Steerpike in tow to catch up with Peggoty, his late mother's maid. Adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring Pauline Quirke and Ciaran McMenamin.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Micawber threatens to expose Uriah Heep for the devious character that he is, and David returns to Canterbury once again. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Bob Hoskins.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. A young man from Poplar is delighted to be accepted into university, but his mother is less than happy. His dreams are jeopardised when his girlfriend gets pregnant, a development that puts pressure on the whole family.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A campaigner against domestic violence is murdered and the prime suspect is an apparently reformed man whose violent behaviour once drove his ex-wife to almost kill him in self defence. Although the team is able to build a solid case against him, Ross jeopardises the investigation in a moment of madness. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring John Michie and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A Polish man is killed on the building site where he worked and soon afterwards a female hotel receptionist is murdered in strikingly similar circumstances. Reid and the team learn she was an immigrant from the same country, and look into whether the killings were ethnically motivated or if there is another link between the pair. Meanwhile, Ross puts his career on the line by spending the night with a woman involved in the case. Blythe Duff and John Michie star.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: In the tense build-up to a world trade summit in Edinburgh, Rebus looks forward to a well-earned day off - until Siobhan rings to say a body has been found in the grounds of the hotel hosting the conference. When a government minister is later killed in a fall from the castle ramparts, the abrasive copper comes up against Commander Steelforth of the SO12 unit providing security for the summit and, not for the first time, finds himself at odds with the Establishment. Julie Graham guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part two of two. A massive police search leads to the body of a missing five-year-old, the victim of sexual assault and strangulation. All the evidence points to a local drunkard being the guilty party _ but as the case goes to trial it becomes clear that the outcome is by no means assured. Gripping crime drama by Lynda La Plante, starring David Hayman, Kate Buffery, Helen McCrory and Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lady Jane and Lovejoy grow closer while visiting a Gothic temple in Scotland. Eric falls head over heels in love and Tinker feels all at sea. Drama, with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: An old flame from Northern Ireland turns up on Sergeant McLeod's doorstep with his six-year-old son in tow - a development his wife is not too pleased about. Jeremy has an embarrassing date with Melanie, and soon realises he has more in common with her mother - but she is married to his commanding officer.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: As the regiment prepares to leave for the South Atlantic to defend Deliverance Island, Andy contemplates proposing, and Sarah and Jeremy's relationship begins to crumble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dan Casper has a humiliating run-in with three yobs and later tries to save face by telling Amber they threatened him with a knife. On a less harrowing note, he also enjoys a romantic encounter with new Drugs Referral Officer Rochelle Barratt. Meanwhile, Honey finally confronts Scott, who breaks down and admits to killing his previous wife Karen. Understandably shocked by his confession, she implores him to turn himself in - but when the police arrive at their house, neither husband nor wife is anywhere to be seen.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess returns to work, and suspects a boy she's treating is being abused by his stepmother, while Jac urges Ric to give her a permanent position at Holby. Mark challenges Diane over Frank's DNA test, and when the truth is confirmed, he takes his frustration out on Chrissie. However, when they reconcile over a drink, he considers telling her the truth. Lynda Bellingham and Kym Marsh guest star.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. When the boat accident victim arrives, the department becomes contaminated with radioactive material, forcing Charlie to close A&E. Trapped inside, Chloe has to reveal she's pregnant to ensure her unborn child's safety, while a suspected murderer waits anxiously as the military police close in.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Aidan decides to leave Albert Square, Pauline's new found friend causes issues for Arthur and love is in the air when Clyde meets an old family friend.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Aidan makes preparations to leave Albert Square, with Mandy in hot pursuit and Pauline's late nights are taking their toll on Arthur.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: An unexploded bomb is discovered next door to Blackwall, which sparks a series of events for the Black Watch, culminating in a fatal fire.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie makes a disturbing discovery about Hector while ploughing her way through Glenbogle's accounts. Archie has trouble adjusting to life without Golly, but when a mystery man rescues a youngster lost in the wildlife park, he and Duncan realise fate has given them a vital clue to the gamekeeper's whereabouts.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna attacks a faith healer's controversial methods, especially when a youngster with arthritis refuses conventional treatment, and Simon comes under increasing pressure from a hotshot Canadian businessman who makes a shocking takeover bid for his company. Meanwhile, Beth moves in with Vic and Lucy, and Henry gets the sympathy vote from Jess _ but will she find out he's been faking his symptoms?.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian struggles with celebrity as Jack and Leonora's relationship blooms. Grandad, meanwhile, gets a reminder from the past.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The new controller wreaks havoc at Maplins as he sets about firing numerous members of staff, and upsets Peggy in the process. Comedy, starring Paul Shane and Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but tries to pretend everything is fine when her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen pay a visit. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The Trio go on a field trip to a historical home, but end up baby-sitting for relatives of Compo.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The coppers search for the killer of docusoap star Efrona Davis, whose body has been found washed ashore. It soon emerges that she received a knock to the head before entering the water, and the list of suspects includes her father, Wayland Bay's resident comedian Rowan Priestley and Gavin Oldham, a man she arranged a date with on the night she died. The investigation takes a surprising turn when a second body is found on the beach. Ricky Tomlinson and John McArdle guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A recent rape is linked to two similar attacks at a chocolate factory 10 years previously, leaving the team with no choice but to reopen all three cases. The detectives uncover news not only of an unhappy workforce, but also of an alleged suicide, and their investigation becomes even more complicated when they discover a severed finger was found in one of the company's snacks. After a visit to the doctor, Gerry decides to quit smoking, and instead of resorting to nicotine patches or gum, he enlists Sandra to help him quit.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team reinvestigates the work of serial killer James Jenson when the wallets of his victims surface on the day he is released from a secure psychiatric unit. However, after turning the spotlight on a second suspect, Dr Bruno Rivelli, and the children's home he previously ran, they find themselves with another murder case on their hands.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A remote British-ruled island in the South Pacific is invaded and the King's Own Fusiliers find themselves part of the task force sent to retake it. Unfortunately, Corporal Hobbs is soon captured and tortured by enemy troops, and Colonel Eastwood's daring plan of attack has explosive consequences.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Butcher celebrates his forthcoming wedding to Stacey with a riotous stag party in France, but finds Continental hospitality losing its allure after a transport strike strands him on the wrong side of the Channel. While Steve Evans pulls out all the stops to get his friend to the church on time, Dr Sarah Eastwood faces an agonising romantic dilemma and Chris comes to a momentous decision.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie treats a patient who used to bully her at school - and a few other facts about her past come to light. Elliot decides not to apply for the clinical lead job, but Ric asks him to reconsider. Donna and Mickie clash while working together on Keller, and Lola is concerned Mark is getting too emotionally involved in a case.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sam questions his future at the hospital during his recovery from the attack, while bed manager Adam wonders whether he should return to nursing, and a management training team courts disaster while competing on an assault course. Starring Derek Thompson and Jonathan Kerrigan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gita gives Ian some advice, and Grant and Phil rescue Nigel from his birthday blues. Jules makes a confession to Dot, and Michele is suspicious of a blossoming new friendship.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: There is some unexpected news at the Taverniers.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The propane cylinder storage depot blaze continues, leaving Jaffa badly burned and plunging George into agonies of guilt. Nick clashes with Skase over how to handle the emergency, and later learns to his dismay that Ariadne has gone missing, while on a quieter note, Recall and Laura enjoy a break from the children. Andrew Kazamia, Glen Murphy, and Richard Walsh star.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie faces losing the estate as he struggles to find a way to pay off Hector's death duties, and Greg capitalises on the situation by offering to buy the property - but just when all seems lost an affluent traveller offers a solution to the predicament. Meanwhile, Irene's secret past threatens to destroy her relationship with Duncan.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger returns to Skelthwaite on a mission to find his long-lost father. Simon takes radical steps to thwart business rival Conrad Walker's plans, and Anna makes a decision about the baby's upbringing. Drama, starring Tony Haygarth, Leslie Ash and Lesley Dunlop.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's mooning over a new love, Joey's mooning over an old one and Jack's completely besotted with Leonora.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The new boss makes his presence felt in the holiday camp with a spate of sackings. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel moves in with Jean, but each has trouble letting go of their independence. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo shocks everyone by making an effort to dress smartly in an attempt to woo a lady. Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo is shocked when a single mother, fighting a lawsuit against the mobile phone company she blames for her incurable cancer, asks her to take care of her son after she dies. Presiding in the case, Deed finds himself at the centre of a plot between the phone company and Sir Ian Rochester, both of whom are eager to have him out of the way.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An unknown tagger begins to paint graffiti around London, and claims to have been responsible for killing a celebrated street artist four years previously. Originally part of a gang, the victim went solo after receiving support from a wealthy art patron, and when the detectives reopen the case, they become suspicious of his resentful former crew members. Meanwhile, Brian signs up to a social networking site as TopCop999 to chart the gritty life of a lawman, much to his colleagues' displeasure.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team investigates after a man convicted of murdering his parents escapes from a psychiatric unit and reveals the location of a decomposed corpse. The remains are identified as those of a student who went missing in the 1960s, and a link is made between the two crimes. However, time is of the essence in tracking down their suspect when an elderly psychiatrist is taken captive.

programme.desc: Lieutenant Colonel Philip Drysdale, the new CO, arrives with his traditional views on army life and is unimpressed the attitude of B Company's men.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The arrival of strict new sergeant-major Alan Fitzpatrick causes quite a stir among the ranks, while memories of traumatic episode from Hobbs' past come flooding back during an exercise, threatening his chances of promotion. The boys persuade a reluctant Butcher to invest in a greyhound and the wives reveal their competitive side while organising a charity auction.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane returns to work but she and Jac take an instant dislike to one another - and Ric does not help matters by suggesting they both apply for the consultant's job. Mickie is not impressed when new nurse Kyla takes an extended break, but softens once she learns the reason. Mark's animosity toward Ben's mother softens, but Lola still thinks he is getting too involved in the case - especially as the boy's chances of survival ebb away.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Adam reveals he is HIV-positive, placing Charlie in the unenviable position of deciding what action _ if any _ he should take. Sunny proves to be something of a loose cannon, allowing his temper to get the better of him, and an accident prompts a grandmother to accept a few home truths. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. Yvonne is suspended from duty pending further investigation into the death of young thug Lee Thomas, and Leela is also accused of assaulting a suspect, leaving the relief uncertain as to what constitutes reasonable force when making an arrest. Fearful of leaving himself open to accusations of heavy-handedness or police brutality, Tony later hesitates to use force in a confrontation with local youths - and suffers a horrific beating. Meanwhile Zain Nadir agrees to do a stint in CID before beginning his next undercover job.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Danny begs Pauline to run away with him. Husband Greg begs Christine to have him back - where does this leave Arthur? Grant tells Sharon he's met someone.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant explores a romantic interest under the watchful and jealous eyes of Sharon and Michelle warns Shelley against pursuing a relationship with Mark.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Jaffa is seriously injured when the Blue Watch team attends a nightmarish scenario of burning cars and houses, while Nick mounts a desperate search for Ariadne.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie decides to turn Jamie's room into a nursery, while Lexie becomes convinced there is a ghost in the house after she sees a mysterious figure at the window. Duncan is prompted to take control of his relationship with Irene when she talks about leaving Glenbogle, and Molly is less than impressed with the new neighbour.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Karen tentatively looks forward to seeing her mother for the first time in 25 years, but unfortunately the reunion doesn't turn out as she hoped. Relations are hardly any more harmonious elsewhere, as Oscar continues to give Cheryl the cold shoulder _ leading to a devastating accident at home. Popular drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey goes to inform Martina that the family will be holidaying in Rome for the Christmas period.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Clive's relatives descend on the camp in an effort to stop his marriage to Gladys - which could give the groom-to-be the excuse he has been looking for. Classic comedy, starring David Griffin, Paul Shane and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean take care of Stephen while Penny goes into hospital for a routine operation - but their task is complicated by a case of mistaken identity. Geoffrey Palmer, Judi Dench and Moira Brooker star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg persuades Compo and Blamire to buy a car so they can get around more easily, but the old banger they end up with turns out to be more trouble than it is worth.

programme.desc: An elderly man is killed in his dilapidated mansion, prompting Gently and Bacchus to delve into the building's past as a children's home. They soon have their prime suspect - a man who once lived there - but it becomes clear that some of the locals, including property developer Cora Davidson, have something to hide. Feature-length drama, guest starring Matthew McNulty and Jill Halfpenny, with Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.desc: When a retrospective exhibition of murdered fashion designer Ritchie Levene's work opens, the team is prompted to re-examine the three-year-old crime. The detectives learn about his tempestuous relationships with his new spouse, personal assistant and ex-wife Sarah, who believes his brother Adrian is the killer because he had the most to gain from his death. Meanwhile, Gerry enlists Emily to help update his image, although not everyone is impressed with the results. Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Hannah Waterman.

programme.desc: Boyd receives a Nazi ceremonial dagger in an anonymous package in the post. The weapon prompts him to reopen the unsolved murder file of a girl whose body was found on the street in May 1945 - a case last examined by his former colleague Mel Silver shortly before her death. Feature-length crime drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Personal problems are high on the troops' agenda as Andy Butcher's mother throws his love life into disarray, Angela McCleod's house is broken into and Sergeant-Major Alan Fitzpatrick learns he cannot treat his daughter like a private on parade.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The troops pull out all the stops to save Colonel Drysdale from terrorists stalking him at a racing event, but he seems oblivious to danger. Meanwhile, Andy tries to worm his way back into the CO's good books and Jacko unwittingly antagonises Julie by trying to find out whether she is seeing Tony behind his back.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. Yvonne is suspended from duty pending further investigation into the death of young thug Lee Thomas, and Leela is also accused of assaulting a suspect, leaving the relief uncertain as to what constitutes reasonable force when making an arrest. Fearful of leaving himself open to accusations of heavy-handedness or police brutality, Tony later hesitates to use force in a confrontation with local youths - and suffers a horrific beating. Meanwhile Zain Nadir agrees to do a stint in CID before beginning his next undercover job.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sam performs a risky operation that he has never done before - to Connie's outrage. Elliot gets a new PA but finds she cramps his style, while Chrissie receives a variety of Valentine's gifts from a secret admirer. Paul Nicholas guest stars as a patient whose vasectomy reversal goes horribly wrong.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Duffy's discovery that Adam is HIV-positive threatens the possibility of his return to nursing, and Sunny and Tina visit Sam at his beach retreat in Cornwall - can they persuade him to return to Holby A&E? Starring Jonathan Kerrigan, Cathy Shipton and Vince Pellegrino.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel, fed up with being single, doffs his cap at the elusive Debbie; Ian, struggling to comply with the demands of health and safety is strapped for cash.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The unexpected closure of the 'Meal Machine' is the hot topic on the square. Michelle has concerns over Mark's relationship with Shelley.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a horrendous car crash, Pearce is forced to relive a fatal incident when he attends the resulting inquest and Nick is puzzled by a message from Ariadne.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A mysterious traveller arrives in Glenbogle with some questions about his past, leading to a secret being unearthed. Meanwhile, Lexie resolves to prove herself by making the Ghillies' Ball a success, but when her plans for a traditional Highland celebration are scuppered she decides to organise an event in her own unique style.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A pregnant schoolgirl runs away after confiding in Anna, deciding to have her baby by herself on the moors, and David tires of pandering to Karen, suspecting her mother is the real reason behind the mystery illness. Chris refuses to give up on his relationship with Beth, despite her plans to finish their affair, and Vic becomes riled by Lucy's girlie chats with Jess, finding it hard to accept that his daughter is growing up. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey's past returns to haunt him. Billy finds himself in trouble with the law and Freddie is notable by his absence.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The staff treat April to a trip to the cinema - but a mix-up with the projectionist spells disaster for the outing, as an old war film is shown instead of the intended movie. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy worries she has a stalker when she spots someone following her home at night. Lionel's efforts to calm the situation are unsuccessful, so Alistair steps in to help and manages to uncover the mysterious man's identity.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Inspired by a local art event, Blamire, Compo and Clegg decide to go camping and take some creative photographs of anything that interests them. Michael Bates, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate a case at Smithfield Market when a frozen body is found on a meat truck. The victim is carrying a page of parchment written in Arabic and a counterfeit British passport. A number of suspects emerge, including a dealer in antiquities, a forger, and a surgeon who may have been selling human organs. With Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Mark Benton.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a woman defends her daughter from a mugger, she sets in motion a chain of events that places herself and her children in mortal danger, as her DNA is linked to an old murder case. Meanwhile, Boyd hears news of his son, who has been missing for seven years. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of criminal Mark Johnson, who was killed in a fire at London's Union club in 1996. The original investigation was hampered by silence among witnesses and associates, but with new information suggesting the blaze was a targeted arson attack, the detectives hope they will have more success. Drama, guest starring Roy Marsden, Martin Marquez and Tom Watt.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a horrendous car crash, Pearce is forced to relive a fatal incident when he attends the resulting inquest and Nick is puzzled by a message from Ariadne.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark gets the thumbs-up in his psychiatric report and rejoins the Fusiliers, determined to make a fresh start. Unfortunately, CSM Fitzpatrick isn't convinced he is up to the job and resolves to make life difficult for him, with disastrous consequences for Tony and Jacko.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jessica Bailey finds it a struggle to fit in amongst the regiment, and an officer makes Chris McLeod jealous after he returns from leave.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lola's daughter comes to the hospital with her boyfriend, who has reacted badly to a tetanus injection. However, the news that they are planning to go travelling together does not go down well. Sam advises a patient to fake her symptoms to increase her chances of getting into surgery, with disastrous consequences. Michael French rejoins the cast as consultant Nick Jordan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Eve's friend Gerry is rushed into A&E, forcing her to make a drastic decision, while Holly's attempts to reunite an estranged family meet unexpected complications. Hospital drama, starring Ian Bleasdale, Cathy Shipton and Barbara Marten.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam tries to defuse the threat of strike action by the relief, reminding them of their duties as police officers and offering to let Yvonne return to the station while the inquiry takes its course. Dan reacts with dismay when Rochelle suggests they put their affair on hold, Gary chafes under Suzie's condescending attitude, and Samantha looks on in disbelief as the simmering hostility between brothers Phil and Steve erupts into violence.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur has an unexpected visitor. Phil discovers a new drinking partner. Frank gets a hot tip and Hattie is forced to accept Ian's plans for the future.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel has a dream date. Frank is out of his depth. Greg Hewitt has news for Arthur and Christine.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: What's Santa Brought for Nora Then?
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. Compo has difficulty thinking of what to get Nora for Christmas, so decides to consult Auntie Wainwright for advice. Bill Owen stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A man is murdered at the unveiling of a new church clock and the cleric must act quickly before an innocent woman is sent to the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest becomes involved with a theatrical family when he discovers that a drowning initially thought to be a tragic accident was actually a murder. Drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Josephine Butler and Julian Wadham.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After a man is found hanging in the conservatory following a poetry recital, the priest soon realises he could not have committed suicide, and the search for a murderer begins. Drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: A movie crew from Hollywood arrives in the village to make a film, and pesky pensioners Compo, Clegg and Foggy manage to get themselves roped in as extras. Norman Wisdom guest stars, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The residents are troubled by a bicycle, and Compo's lucky rabbit's foot causes even more problems, while Sid tries his best to avoid Ivy. Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Michael Bates star in the long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Two sisters are found gassed in their home - one a talented author, the other with a terrible secret - and when only one survives, foul play is suspected.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia is horrified to find an injured man stuck in a tree on her estate, apparently thrown there from a passing train on an overhead viaduct. When Sid is implicated as the guilty party, Father Brown is left to clear his name - but only if he is truly innocent. Mystery drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The Church of Apollo comes to Kembleford and Susie is immediately drawn to Kalon, its charismatic leader. After his wife is murdered, Father Brown must break his spell over Susie or risk losing her for ever. Drama, starring Kasia Koleczek, Michael Maloney and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clergyman is called in to investigate when two nuns die in unusual circumstances at St Agnes convent. However, the mystery attracts the attention of Sister Boniface, a would-be sleuth with a passion for detective novels. Crime drama remake, guest starring comedienne Lorna Watson.

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: First episode of Ken Russell's four-part adaptation of DH Lawrence's controversial novel. An aristocratic woman trapped in a sexless marriage embarks on a passionate affair with a gamekeeper. Joely Richardson and Sean Bean star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam tries to defuse the threat of strike action by the relief, reminding them of their duties as police officers and offering to let Yvonne return to the station while the inquiry takes its course. Dan reacts with dismay when Rochelle suggests they put their affair on hold, Gary chafes under Suzie's condescending attitude, and Samantha looks on in disbelief as the simmering hostility between brothers Phil and Steve erupts into violence.

programme.desc: Jessica Bailey finds it a struggle to fit in amongst the regiment, and an officer makes Chris McLeod jealous after he returns from leave.

programme.desc: Nigel has a dream date. Frank is out of his depth. Greg Hewitt has news for Arthur and Christine.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former MP Ann Widdecombe puts on a dinner party as she plays mystery host to four strangers, who have to try and work out her identity using cryptic clues. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Team Veredus play in a special mid-season tournament while Ariston and Mangle help Feronia break out of the Corvus Prison.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on one of the UK's toughest obstacle courses, but can he beat the clock and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is housesitting for Weasel. When he sees him returning from the grocery store with Fizz, he thinks they're burglars!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are at the supermarket buying ingredients to make the world's best cake. They bump into Magoo, who thinks he's at a carnival!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is lost in a pyramid but he is in fact in a big conference room where Fizz is about to perform a stand-up act..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: It's cold, the boiler is broken, and Mr. Bean has to get warm, fast..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A trip to the South Pole goes upside down when Team Tennyson lands on the North Pole instead.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef is joined in the kitchen by singer Paul Young, and whips up a feast with chefs Romy Gill and Paul Rankin. Plus, eco-chef Tom Hunt offers tips on sustainable cooking.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Corsica brings him to the island of Bonifacio, where he learns about its history and culture from tour guide Christine, before whipping up some cheesy stuffed aubergines. He also visits a honey producer, joins a local chef to cook with bovine bread and meets an olive oil-maker, using his some for his fish stew with garlic mayonnaise.

programme.title: Casper (1995)
programme.desc: A paranormal expert moves into a haunted house where his daughter befriends the amiable ghost of a young boy - but things start to go awry when three smelly spooks and two dastardly crooks try to chase the new residents away. Family comedy, starring Christina Ricci, Bill Pullman, Eric Idle, Cathy Moriarty and featuring the voice of Malachi Pearson.

credits.actor: featuring the voice of Malachi Pearson

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five spanning three generations answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Huw, Sudeh, Thomas and Nadia pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The Virtual Grand National
programme.desc: Nick Luck and guests watch as Red Rum takes on Tiger Roll in a special race and they reveal how the 2020 Grand National may have been won.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Emmerdale's Michael Parr (Ross Barton), England footballer Alex Scott, Hollyoaks actress Jennifer Metcalfe (Mercedes McQueen) and TV presenter Bill Turnbull must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore, star guests and a chance for a member of the audience to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks. Following the coronavirus outbreak, the planned series finale at Walt Disney World in Florida has been cancelled. However, the Geordie pair will surely have something up their sleeves to put a smile on the faces of the viewing public.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to £1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Bristol.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.sub-title: The Voice UK: Most Memorable Moments
programme.desc: Will.i.am introduces some of the highlights of the past four series, recalling some of the performances in the Blind Auditions that got the coaches' chairs in a spin, as well as memorable moments from the Battle and Knockout rounds.

programme.title: Inception (2010)
programme.desc: A talented thief uses hi-tech devices to enter other people's dreams so he can steal their secrets. An industrialist hires him to perform a far more challenging job - to implant an idea into a corporate heir's mind, so he will think it is his own. However, the mission is compromised by the thief's own troubled psyche. Christopher Nolan's sci-fi thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Page, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Tom Hardy.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of 10 giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to £10,000
