programme.desc: Mr. Bean enters Scrapper into a beauty contest so that he can win First Prize: a trip with Irma to Paris..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben, Gwen, and Grandpa Max arrive at a Native American national park to witness the Ayasha Plinths.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Frenzied Farts of Flabby Flabulous
programme.desc: An accident with Mr Meaner and Melvin's new machine turns the angry teacher into a super-villain..

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show with John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The menu on this episode includes one pan spicy roast lamb and pear tarte tatin. Plus, The Great British Bake Off's John Whaite showcases his lemon drizzle cake and food writer Ching He Huang prepares teriyaki salmon.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott hops across to the Italian island of Sardinia, where his first stop is the beachside Ristorante La Spigola for a taste of chef Roberto's modern take on Italian dining. He also gets immersed in a classic Sardinian culinary experience, cooking suckling pig over an open fire, has a masterclass in making the local pasta Jiusoni and learns about another island speciality, casizolu cheese.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Documentary about the people who live and work in one of west Wales' most famous and historic communities - the city of St Davids in Pembrokeshire, which has fewer than 2,000 residents. An aeroplane pilot is forced to make an emergency landing on Whitesands beach, while the National Trust wardens try to round up some wild ponies. The men and women go head to head at the Penknife Club fishing competition.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter heads to Loch Lomond, a freshwater Scottish loch famously celebrated in song that crosses the Highland Boundary Fault and is the largest inland stretch of water in Great Britain by surface area. Taking in the popular West Highland way, it's just a quick boat ride to the idyllic island of Inchailloch, a jewel in the loch's crown, where stunning views over the immense mass of water can be enjoyed.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.sub-title: The Voice UK: Most Memorable Moments
programme.desc: Will.i.am introduces some of the highlights of the past four series, recalling some of the performances in the Blind Auditions that got the coaches' chairs in a spin, as well as memorable moments from the Battle and Knockout rounds.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore, star guests and a chance for a member of the audience to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A land dispute escalates during a cowboy fair run by the Wild West Society in the village of Ford Florey. Farmers Jack Fincher and Silas Burbage both claim to own a patch of wasteland known as the Swamp, but Dan Malko wants to buy it and create a travellers' site. Barnaby and Jones are called in when the feud leads to murder during the Wild West-style shoot-outs at the annual event. Guest starring Kenneth Cranham, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli, TV doctor Zoe Williams and former Corrie actress Catherine Tyldesley to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the special edition of the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Walmsleys from Leyland - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: As AJ returns to the hospital keen to impress, Aisha and Lydia come to blows managing Jyoti's case and Greg discovers a shocking secret that Tommy has been hiding. Ruby helps Ted track down a possible lead, while her relationship with Gabriel hits obstacles. Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, Amrita Acharia, Neil Morrissey, Kenneth Cranham and Priyanka Bose.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: John appeals to members of the Trenchards' staff in his bid to uncover the truth about Charles, while Turton and Ellis are quick to betray their employers and prove surprisingly adept at deceit and spying. Susan makes a seemingly miraculous discovery, and begrudgingly agrees to accompany Anne and James to their country estate in the hope of extracting further information about Oliver. Stephen makes a last-ditch attempt to secure the funds he needs to pay off his debt - a deal that puts his life in danger.

programme.title: The Olivier Awards
programme.desc: Jason Manford presents the best moments from the past few moments of the theatrical awards, with a line-up of star-studded cast of award-winners and presenters taking to the stage to celebrate the best in live theatre. Including performances by the casts of The Lion King, Mamma Mia!, The Book of Mormon, Hamilton, Dreamgirls, Come from Away and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: An insight into the world of the driving test, filmed over a two-year period and offering unprecedented access to the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA), with cameras fitted inside and outside of the test car. In the first episode, examiner Wayne has the task of taking 27-year-old Shaunna from Hull through the driving test, which will be her 12th attempt at passing. In Cardiff, Drew is desperate to pass, if only to stop the arguments with his partner Karl, who's been teaching him to drive. Narrated by Alan Carr.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie is in need of some time alone so she heads to the pub to see if she can get a room for the night, where she learns the real story of landlord Brian. When she finds out there are no rooms free for her to stay, Maggie decides to go and stay with daughter-in-law Becka, and the pair have a rare moment of bonding. Meanwhile, Peter is working late at the school when his secretary Karen reveals her feelings towards him in a very unexpected way. Later, Alex desperately tries to find the 'lottery' winnings' to pay off the lenders.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Australian Wilderness with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer follows the Frankland River into the heart of the 65 million-year-old Walpole Forest - 200 square kilometres of wooded wilderness in Western Australia that provides food and shelter for Aboriginal people. Ray learns that the river was once used by loggers to transport jarrah wood, which is so hard it was used as cobbles for London streets in Victorian times. In the forest, the adventurer lies in wait for the elusive quokka, a small and shy marsupial, and meets environmentalist Prue Anderson, who shows him some of the other forest creatures that she's captured on her hidden camera.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Malone quietly seethes when the police discover his 4x4 smoldering in a field, Chas railroads Belle into attending Take a Vow's lingerie party, and Mandy encourages Bob to tell Wendy how he really feels.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff despairs as Yasmeen walks out on him, Bernie implores Chesney to keep a close eye on Gemma, and Michael attends a job interview at Underworld. David heads out for a walk, but when Gail quizzes him, he refuses to tell her where he's going.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Forager Julia scours the shoreline for seaweed for her sustainable soaps, the bug farm hosts its summer fair and the residents of Britain's smallest city celebrate the end of the busy summer season at farmer Gerald's harvest party.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Now reunited with Katy, Laura takes drastic measures to hold the person framing her to account in a last-ditch bid for her freedom. But first, she must discover his identity and where he's hiding. To achieve what she needs to prove her innocence, she is forced to collude with the most surprising of people and the shocking truth of what happened on the morning Andrew died is finally revealed. Conclusion of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Keane & Vieira - Best of Enemies
programme.desc: The on-field rivalry between midfielders Roy Keane and Patrick Vieira during their time at Manchester United and Arsenal respectively, when they strived for dominance in a golden period for the clubs. There was no love lost between the two combative players, who captained their teams and enjoyed many memorable battles in the quest for Premier League glory. In this programme, Gabriel Clarke interviews both men.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win £25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands

The trip concludes with a visit to Sennen beach, where they practice their oil painting and break out the barbecue.

programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter embarks on her favourite countryside walk through the rolling plains of Cheshire, a trail with eight counties on show, two castles to explore and spectacular views across to Wales and Liverpool. A popular route for dog-walkers and sports, her trek proves to be full of surprises.

programme.title: Tales from the Coast with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor meets people who share his passion for the British coast, beginning with north Devon, a 90-mile stretch of shoreline that holds fond childhood memories for him. Robson starts his adventures by visiting the popular seaside resort of Ilfracombe, a town that stills attracts thousands of visitors every summer, to experience the classic British day out by the sea. After spending a night under canvas, he takes a boat ride to the port of Clovelly, a village that evokes the character and atmosphere of a bygone age, and visits the island of Lundy.

programme.title: Return to Belsen
programme.desc: Jonathan Dimbleby returns to the site of the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp on the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the survivors by British troops. Jonathan's father was with the Allied forces as a reporter, and his account was one of the first to bring the full horrors of the Holocaust to the world's attention. Featuring contributions from survivors, liberators, and their children.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having previously toured their own countries, Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix now hit the highways of of the States - although in the first episode, they are in Mexico, on a mission to taste the world's best breakfast. Along the way, the trio take part in a chili-eating competition, have a beach buggy race and watch some traditional Mexican wrestling - but it isn't long before they are persuaded not take part.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Despite Kate being sued after an accident in the cafe, she refuses to back down and Koji is reluctant to get involved. Although Medium is convinced she should just apologise and get it over with, Kate suspects the legal threats may have something to do with Councillor Bone. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: John appeals to members of the Trenchards' staff in his bid to uncover the truth about Charles, while Turton and Ellis are quick to betray their employers and prove surprisingly adept at deceit and spying. programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster returns to travel more of Britain's canal network, exploring the extraordinary stories of the people and places on the way. The series starts with John navigating the Peak Forest Canal, which runs through stunning countryside from Buxworth in Derbyshire to Ashton-under-Lyne. Along the way, in Hyde he meets former boxer Ricky Hatton, who discusses his plans to revitalise the area and offer new opportunities to local youngsters, and joins a team of junior archaeologists at Mellor Mill, who are attempting to unearth the remains of what was once one of the world's largest mills.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie explains to Paddy that the only way to solve his money problems is to fire Belle, Al and Priya share a passionate kiss and Malone puts Billy in a difficult position.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gemma boards the bus with the quads, but is suddenly overcome by a wave of anxiety and hurries off the bus, leaving her babies behind. The return of Rick's daughter Kelly rattles Gary, and Yasmeen consults the police about Geoff's past.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When word reaches that a storm is headed for town, Kate refuses to step in line, much to the grief of Councillor Bone. Koji discovers he has been given a jacket with an unfortunate history, and Medium may have lost Kate a lot of money on the horses. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. This time, Paul meets a 10-month-old puppy who has been brought into Battersea twice for being too boisterous, before helping to soothe a pointer cross who has had a hard life.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: As the drama concludes, Roxanna is terrified by Alex's behaviour the previous night, and tries desperately to get to Alex before he confronts the money lenders. Meanwhile, Jill is still feeling shaken after witnessing Peter and Karen kissing and wonders if she should tell Maggie what has happened. As everyone gathers for the village celebrations, a sudden shocking series of events are put in motion that could potentially cost the life of one beloved villager. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap and Gwyneth Keyworth.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Spirit of Queensland: Brisbane to Cairns
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones journeys from Brisbane to Cairns aboard the Spirit of Queensland railway - and during his various stops, he comes across all manner of things that seem determined to kill him, from jellyfish to dingoes to whitewater rapids and more.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Coronavirus: How Safe Are Our Jobs? Tonight
programme.desc: Just a couple of months ago the economy was riding high with employment at record levels. But that was before the coronavirus epidemic tightened its grip on Britain, ripping up the way of life. In the past 14 days half a million people have signed on for Universal Credit. With the Government projected to spend many tens of billions in a bid to keep the economy, and jobs, afloat, Sonali Shah investigates: how safe are British jobs?.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay aims to show his companions that US food lives up to its reputation of being bigger and better as they travel from Nevada to Los Angeles. They begin in style with a helicopter ride about the Grand Canyon - although Gino is too nervous to appreciate the spectacle below him. Next up is a trout fishing trip contest in the Colorado River, followed by a burger in Las Vegas with a hefty price tag of $777 and a visit to a ranch where they have to round up herds of cattle on horseback. Finally, they hit Los Angeles, where they have a barbecue battle.

programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James and fellow chef Mark Jordan discover the culinary delights of Guernsey. They sample local speciality Gache cake and a seafood platter fit for a king, while James uses the island's native dairy produce to make a creamy rice pudding with chargrilled peaches. The duo set themselves a fishing challenge by attempting to catch a mighty turbot, and James finishes the day by cooking a mouthwatering turbot dish.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a male voice choir answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to £1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Bristol.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Mandy insists on planning Lydia's hen night, as well as Sam's stag, but Lydia is unsure. Paddy agrees to Jamie's plan and Rodney struggles running the café.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve regrets prioritising Emma's needs over Oliver's, Gemma returns home and finally admits to Chesney that she thinks she's a terrible mother and no longer feels in control, while Ken decides to challenge Charles' supremacy.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of 29-year-old Niall is made difficult by those closest to him, who seem intent on obscuring the facts, and it is not until the body of a drug dealer washes up on a beach that the dreadful truth begins to emerge. While coping with revelations of her own, Vera sifts through evidence of the grief, love and addiction that characterised Niall's life as she tries to find out why someone wanted him dead. With Judy Parfitt (Call the Midwife) and Phyllis Logan (Downton Abbey).

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: The Theory of Everything (2014)
programme.desc: Biopic of Stephen Hawking, exploring the renowned astrophysicist's romance with future wife Jane during their time at university in the 1960s and his initial diagnosis with motor neurone disease, which doctors believed would lead to his death within two years. Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV presenter Charlotte Hawkins puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to track down the first-ever Bond car, a 1963 Sunbeam Alpine. He finds a rust-free, race-ready motor, but Edd China discovers some surprises in the engine bay.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The mining season is almost over and Col's crew takes one last gamble opal-spotting from the air. The Cooke brothers strive to save their mega opal machine and disastrous season.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The crew creates a chopper for a medical transport company, but struggles with the challenge of working out how to fit an ambulance stretcher into a sidecar.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: In California, Mike tries to snatch a plane in broad daylight, while Kevin tries to heist a $2million prize by posing as a pilot.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe gets wet while shrink-wrapping a steel boat to protect it from winter weather, before heading to Alaska to wrangle reindeer.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The development process behind the manufacturing of wood windows, and the production of woven cashmere.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A chance to discover the manufacturing processes that go into the production of gas barbecues and mattress pads.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part one of two. A menacing storm moves into the fleet, with a wave ripping steel at the Cape Caution. Freshman skipper Jake finds it difficult to battle through the winds.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: An insight into how a mega fish factory produced three million pounds of seafood a day. Plus, a flying ambulance operating 14,000 feet above Alaska's wilderness.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mechanic Edd China teams up with Mike Brewer to get a classic Saab 900 Turbo back on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China face the challenge of working to a tight budget as they continue with the Saab 900 Turbo restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Volvo P1800 - but owing to a lack of available specimens, has trouble finding one that fits into his price range.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes the Chevy to Sweden, where there is a big market for American cars, and hopes to trade his way up to a Volvo Sports Coupe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants a high-performance car with a historic badge, but it proves difficult to find a Saab 9-3 Turbo at a good price for mechanic Edd China to refurbish.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is challenged to find a classic endurance sports car, and a still-running Volvo PV544 seems to be the perfect example, but the engine proves difficult to master.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead try to arouse the passion of the Saab enthusiast community by restoring a rusty, non-driving 1973 Saab 96 to its past glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Jensen Interceptor, but his £5,000 budget restricts him to poor examples of the car, leaving mechanic Edd China with plenty of work to do.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to Poland to source an FSM Syrena, but with the model being virtually unknown outside of the country, he and Edd China could struggle to make a profit.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: South American Squatch of Argentina: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: A bigfoot-like beast with superhuman strength is reported to live in the foothills of the Andes. Mungo goes on the trail of the Ucumar, believed to be a bear - or even a yeti.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheepyards, the Bushmen are desperate for a breakthrough after a run of bad luck. In White Cliffs, the Young Guns are under financial strain and fall out over their new mine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead claim ownership of a seriously distressed 1965 Dodge A-100 Sportsman, and hopes a custom-built surf inspired makeover will be enough to attract a buyer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a salvage yard in Cheshire containing vintage gym equipment with real muscle. At an antique shop on the south coast, he spots some decorative religious moulds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a country estate mentioned in the Domesday Book, unearths a cupboard that has been unopened for decades and finds a weathervane dating to 1800

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life, and Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window.

programme.title: Robson Green's Australian Adventure
programme.desc: The actor journey takes him to Australia's Northern Territory, where he discovers how people thrive within the wilderness, starting at the Top End in the waters of Darwin harbour.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheepyards, the Bushmen are desperate for a breakthrough after a run of bad luck. In White Cliffs, the Young Guns are under financial strain and fall out over their new mine.

programme.title: Explosions Gone Wrong
programme.desc: Experts examine the science behind big blasts and suggest how they can be prevented. Featuring footage of exploding buildings, roads, trains and other vehicles.

programme.title: Quest for Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Barry Clifford travels to Madagascar, where he discovers relics and traces of the ship that once belonged to one of the world's most infamous pirates.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The teams sets about building a bike for Mike Buehrle of the Chicago White Sox baseball team, and Paul Jr pushes himself hard to get his new company up and running.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Adrenaline junkie Mike Kennedy sets out into the remote Alaskan wilderness, braving wolf country and bitter temperatures, in a hunt for a Piper Super Cub.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on a succession of unpleasant tasks, this time learning how to make maple syrup.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How skateboards are manufactured and braided pastry produced, and how techniques have changed with the passage of time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing process behind plasma gems are manufactured and a look at how special effects snow is made.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: South American Squatch of Argentina: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: A bigfoot-like beast with superhuman strength is reported to live in the foothills of the Andes. Mungo goes on the trail of the Ucumar, believed to be a bear - or even a yeti.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz help find an important part for a million-dollar car. Later, the guys pick over a massive bike shop closed since the 1980s.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead claim ownership of a seriously distressed 1965 Dodge A-100 Sportsman, and hopes a custom-built surf inspired makeover will be enough to attract a buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Smart city car the Fiat Panda is also a surprisingly good off-road hack. Mike Brewer tracks down a 4x4 model with potential, passing the vehicle on to mechanic Edd China, as the pair try to turn a profit improving its credentials before selling it on.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.desc: The story of Ashley, who at 670 pounds is desperate to save her life and her marriage to husband David. She is also hopeful weight-loss surgery can give her the chance for a family of her own.
